other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is moderately distended with a diffusely thickened wall and marked surrounding fat stranding. There is minimal central intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The common bile duct is mildly prominent measuring up to 7 mm. Wall thickening and mucosal hyperenhancement along the rectum and distal sigmoid colon unchanged likely relates to the patient's known history of ulcerative colitis. Wall thickening along a collapsed segment of the distal transverse colon near an area of inflammatory change related to secondary involvement.
1+ (<1 per 1000X FIELD): POLYMORPHONUCLEAR LEUKOCYTES. NO MICROORGANISMS SEEN.
